availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Nisbet (Hopkins Co., KY, farmer)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of James Nisbet and Mary Ann B. Pritchett Nisbet. Married to Mary Nisbet. Father of Mary E. Nisbet, B. R. Nisbet, John Nisbet, Laura C. Nisbet, and James F. Nisbet. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 49B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 617.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 823.
Sons of the American Revolution Membership Applications, 1889-1970, National Society of the Sons of the American Revolution, Louisville, Ky, National #76259, State #950.
"James Moore Nisbet (1829-1915)," Find A Grave, Memorial #67174921, accessed October 27, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/67174921.
